title.narrative: World Books cultural event: Africa and the Middle East

description.narrative: The project involves organizing a cultural event ?World Books? that includes communication and active discussion on current global issues reality of development countries (specially in Africa and in the Middle East) and development policy. The project trea ts its themes through a versatile and provoking cultural program and has also a global educational purpose. From 4 to 5 authors or NGO activists will be invited from Africa or Middle East or from elsewhere in global South.World Books event will be held in the Helsinki Railway Square during the World Village festival in May 23?24 2015. The event includes versatile non-stop program and discussions authors? and civil society activists? interviews and side events. During the weekend approximately 40 presentatio ns are organized and around 60 authors journalists civil society activists and other experts will take part in them. The event has free entrance. With the help of program and invitees the project discusses the African and Middle Eastern reality development environmental issues human rights and economy. The project informs the Finnish audience in an interesting way about various development policy issues and it has an aim of raising discussion increasing knowledge presenting its topics in a compelling manner and increasing the responsibility and awareness of global topics among Finnish people. It is important that the program deals current issues is interesting from the audience?s point of view and coincides with the project?s themes. The project is directed at thousands of people with its communication and actions. The actions will be communicated through the website www.maailmankirjat.fi and through social media. Also wide media coverage marketing and informing about the events is essential so that the proje ct would reach as many people as possible. The project reaches also new audiences that may not have earlier knowledge or interest in the project?s themes.The project will employ a part-time coordinator and a communicator. It will collaborate with various N GOs and other parties such as publishers.
